definition: (onom.) sound of dripping water, a ticking clock etc
(onom.) for the sound of a bird, an empty stomach etc
to hesitate/to have second thoughts/to be concerned/to brood (over sth)/to complain

sentences.english: A man near the general muttered “Fringe- squib” under his breath.
sentences.chinese: 将军声旁的一位士兵嘀咕讽刺地嘀咕。

sentences.english: A man near the general muttered “Fringe- squib” under his breath.
sentences.chinese: 将军声旁的一位士兵嘀咕讽刺地嘀咕。
她老是一个人嘀嘀咕咕。
“什么世道，”那男人嘀咕了一下。

sentences.english: "This lousy pen", whisper, again in the old newspaper top in disorder uniform spirit.
sentences.chinese: “这破笔”，嘀咕着，又在旧报纸上乱划一气。

sentences.english: Actors often mutter to themselves when rehearsing their lines.
sentences.chinese: 演员背台词的时候经常自己嘀嘀咕咕。

sentences.english: Never murmurs about my flaws to the cat.

sentences.chinese: 我那十三岁的女儿嘀咕埋怨。

sentences.english: Say it to his face, not behind his back.
sentences.chinese: 当面直言，不要背地嘀咕。

sentences.english: muttered the Hatter. 'Does YOUR watch tell you what year it is?'
sentences.chinese: 帽匠嘀咕着，“你的表告诉你哪一年吗？”

sentences.english: What are you muttering there below your breath?
sentences.chinese: 她老是一个人嘀嘀咕咕。

sentences.english: Don't whisper; if you've got something to say, say it out loud.
sentences.chinese: 别嘀咕了，如果有话要说就大声说出来吧。

sentences.english: Although the He Chen together purple Yi leaves, the crowd of the surroundings murmurs in the small voice.
sentences.chinese: 贺宸同紫怡虽然离开，周围的人群却在小声嘀咕。

sentences.english: With that, he left the room, muttering under his breath.
sentences.chinese: 说完他就离开会厅，小声的嘀咕。

sentences.english: Darrow had whispered, throwing a reassuring arm round my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 达罗搂著我的肩膀，在我耳旁嘀咕几句，叫我放心。

definition: to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
to talk about often/to reminisce about/to keep repeating/to keep harping on/to discuss
